timeline.message:
Fix duplicate registration of MetricPublicationFilters

See internal ticket PG-154380

timeline.bodyText: I'll reshuffle things around a bit - this is a bit strange to keep on the API because DedupFilterHolder is private
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.message: Merge branch 'bugfix/dedup-metric-pub-filters' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into bugfix/dedup-metric-pub-filters

timeline.bodyText:
nit: If you're using ImmutableSet elsewhere, the ImmutableSet javadoc recommends:
Returns an immutable set containing {@code element}. 
Preferred over {@link Collections#singleton} for code consistency, 
{@code null} rejection, and because the return type conveys the immutability guarantee.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: Is there any reason why this does not use @Value.Immutable? As far as I can tell, the equality check is very similar to the Immutables one, if not exactly equivalent.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -69,4 +80,41 @@ private static boolean safeShouldPublish(MetricName metricName, MetricPublicatio
             return true;
         }
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Most users will want to define filters without having to think about deduplicating
+     * filters across calls (similar to how MetricsRegistry methods are all registerOrGet)
+     * so in order to keep the existing ability to define filters with lambdas,
+     * define a default method on {@link MetricPublicationFilter} with a reasonable deduplicator
+     * and then wrap it here.
+     */
+    @VisibleForTesting
+    static class DeduplicatingFilterHolder {

replies.bodyText: Not that I'm aware of (other than this being what @dxiao had written)
replies.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: no reason, it was just faster to write.
replies.author: dxiao

timeline.bodyText: This isn't used anywhere in AtlasDB itself - presumably it is exposed for users of Atlas?
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: exposed for future proofing, more than anything else. if you want to internalize it, fine by em.
replies.author: dxiao

timeline.bodyText: nit: Can we extract a constant for the () -> false and () -> true calls?
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

timeline.bodyText: nit: Not convinced we need or want this in the changelog.
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+type: fix
+fix:
+  description: |-
+    Fix duplicate registration of MetricPublicationFilters. Previously, the same filter could be registered multiple times leading to unnecessary evaluations.
+
+    See internal ticket PG-154380.

replies.bodyText: I'd keep this: it causes a substantial perf regression especially if you use leader blocks (though maybe I should say that)
replies.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: Added a line about it causing perf regressions.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.message: Merge branch 'bugfix/dedup-metric-pub-filters' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into bugfix/dedup-metric-pub-filters
